recipes.title: Asian Chicken Salad
recipes.source_note: Food Network Magazine - KFC copycat

ingredients.item: KFC Breast (with corn, coleslaw and a biscuit)

instructions.text: Discard the chicken skin and shred the meat from a KFC Breast.
Whisk 1 tablespoon each rice vinegar, low-sodium soy sauce, brown sugar, 1 teaspoon grated ginger, 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes and 1 tablespoon sesame oil.
Toss the chicken with the salad. Cut the biscuit into cubes and toss with the salad; pepper to taste. Toast in a 350°F oven until crunchy, then sprinkle over the salad.

notes: The makeover cuts the fat by 80 percent while keeping the Colonel's secret herbs and spices.

recipes.title: Smoked Trout and Grapefruit Salad
recipes.source_note: Food Network Magazine December 2010

ingredients.item: kosher salt and freshly ground pepper
Bibb lettuce, torn into bite-size pieces
smoked trout, skin discarded and fish flaked

instructions.text: Grate ¼ teaspoon zest from the grapefruit and set aside. Trim the ends from the grapefruit, then cut away the peel and white pith. Working over a bowl, cut along both sides of each membrane with a paring knife to remove the segments. Discard any seeds. Cut the grapefruit segments into pieces. Squeeze the juice from the membranes into the bowl.
Make the dressing: Whisk the sour cream, 2 tablespoons of the grapefruit juice, the grapefruit zest, scallions, 2 tablespoons water and ½ teaspoon each salt and pepper in a bowl.

Toss the watercress, endive, lettuce, celery and onion in a large bowl. Add the dressing and toss to coat. Divide the salad among shallow bowls. Top with the reserved grapefruit segments and the smoked trout.

notes: This salad also tastes great with ham or smoked chicken from the deli.

recipes.title: Salt-Roasted Beet Carpaccio
recipes.source_note: Food Network Magazine December 2010

ingredients.item: extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for drizzling

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350°. Put a ¼-inch layer of salt in the bottom of a small baking dish. Place the beets on top of the salt, making sure they are not touching each other. Cover the beets with the remaining salt (save some for seasoning) and bake until fork-tender, about 1 hour, 15 minutes. Remove the beets from the salt and let cool to room temperature.
Meanwhile, make the dressing: Puree the goat cheese, crème fraîche, olive oil, vinegar and shallot in a blender until smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Refrigerate until ready to use.

Heat the vegetable oil in a small skillet over medium heat until shimmering. Add the sage leaves and fry until crisp, 5 to 10 seconds. Transfer with a slotted spoon to a paper towel-lined plate to drain; season lightly with salt.

Peel the beets (the skins will slip right off) and slice into thin rounds using a mandoline or sharp knife. Divide the beet slices among plates. Spoon some of the goat cheese dressing on top. Put the arugula in a bowl, drizzle with the lemon juice and olive oil, season with salt and toss. Add the arugula salad to the plates; drizzle with more goat cheese dressing, if desired. Top with the pine nuts and fried sage.

recipes.title: Tuna Nicoise Salad
recipes.source_note: Recipe Keeper app screenshot
recipes.description: Classic French composed salad with tuna, potatoes, green beans, eggs, and olives.

ingredients.item: cooked tuna steaks or canned tuna

instructions.text: Cook the potatoes until just tender, cool in ice water and peel and quarter.
Top and tail the beans and boil in water for 5 minutes, cool in ice water.
Tear the lettuce into small pieces and arrange on a large plate.
Chop the tomatoes into quarters and add to the plate.
Cut the tuna into large chunks and add to the plate.
Add the potatoes, beans, sliced onion, eggs, olives and scatter over the chopped parsley.
In a small bowl mix the oil, vinegar, garlic, salt and pepper. Pour over the salad and serve.

recipes.title: Fattoosh
recipes.source_note: Lebanese Recipes cookbook
recipes.description: Traditional Lebanese bread salad with crispy pita, fresh vegetables, sumac, and mint.

instructions.text: Set your oven to 425 degrees before doing anything else.
Put pita in a baking dish. Bake pita for 5 mins in the oven.
Remove the baking dish and set it to the side for cooling. Now break the pita into small pieces.
Grab the following ingredients: green peppers, lettuce, radishes, tomatoes, olives, onions, cucumber and the baked pita pieces.
Put all of the ingredients into a salad bowl and add: salt, mint, and sumac. Toss evenly.
Add some olive oil and lemon juice. Chill the salad in the fridge.
Enjoy.

notes: Chill the salad in the fridge.

recipes.title: Lebanese Rubbed Salad
recipes.source_note: Lebanese Recipes cookbook
recipes.description: A fresh salad with mixed greens, feta cheese, and balsamic vinegar, hand-mixed for even coating.

instructions.text: To begin let's get a big container (possibly a big bowl).
Into our container add the following items: feta cheese, cucumber, cherry tomatoes, and some garlic.
Also combine with the items some salt and pepper. Make sure you combine the mixture well by tossing.
Now we want to add some olive oil and vinegar to the mix for extra tastiness.
Now let's make sure we have some clean hands and mix everything together for about two mins.
Our goal is getting the greens nice and evenly covered. Once the greens are coated evenly the dish is ready for plating.
Serve and enjoy.

recipes.title: Lebanese Bean Salad
recipes.source_note: Lebanese Recipes cookbook
recipes.description: A hearty three-bean salad with fava beans, chickpeas, and white beans marinated in lemon and garlic.

instructions.text: To make this recipe let's start with a large dish for mixing (possibly a bowl) and place into our container the following items: juiced lemon, fava beans, garlic, chickpeas, olive oil, white beans, and some parsley.
Combine with the mixture some black pepper and some salt.
Put the container in the fridge for about two hrs to let everything marinate and cool off.
Plate, enjoy.

notes: Put the container in the fridge for about two hours to let everything marinate and cool off.

recipes.title: Lebanese Radish Salad
recipes.source_note: Lebanese Recipes cookbook
recipes.description: A refreshing salad with crisp radishes, toasted walnuts, mint ribbons, and honey-lemon dressing.

ingredients.prep_note: trimmed and sliced into thin rounds

instructions.text: To make this salad we first need to grab a frying pan or skillet. Get the pan nice and hot with a medium level of heat and throw into the pan your walnuts.

Cook the walnuts until they are toasted and you smell their nice fragrance. You'll notice the colour of the walnuts change to a darker one when they are ready for the next step. This should take about 4 mins.
Once the walnuts are toasted, we want to dice them nicely.
Grab a container and place into it some radishes.
Grab another container (but smaller) and place the following it: honey, oil, salt, and juiced lemons.
Mix the contents together in the small bowl. Take this mixture and cover the radishes with it evenly. You may want to toss the radishes to get your even coating.
Now we want to grab some mint leaves and place them on top of each other in layers on the counter. Once layered, roll them up, and cut them to create a ribbon like shape.
Take your mint ribbons and combine them with the radishes and the walnuts.
Serve as is. Enjoy.

recipes.title: Tabouli
recipes.description: A refreshing Lebanese salad of bulgur wheat, fresh herbs, tomatoes, and lemon-olive oil dressing.

instructions.text: Pour boiling water over bulgur, cover and let sit 20 minutes.
Combine bulgur with all other ingredients. Toss and refrigerate 1 hour.

recipes.source_note: Lebanese Recipes digital cookbook

recipes.title: Cucumber Tomato Salad
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: From the colors alone, you can tell this cucumber tomato salad will be bursting with fresh flavors. The feta cheese adds a layer of tang and creaminess. Chilling time aside, this recipe is ready in a matter of minutes.

ingredients.item: 1 large English cucumber, halved and sliced
1 medium red onion, halved and thinly sliced

instructions.text: In a large bowl, combine the cucumber slices, grape tomato halves and sliced red onion. Add the vinaigrette and toss to coat. Refrigerate, covered, until you’re ready to serve. Just before serving, stir in the crumbled feta cheese and serve with a slotted spoon. Editor’s Tip: To avoid a watery salad, you can salt the tomatoes and cucumber first then discard the liquid. The salt draws out excess moisture.

recipes.title: Berry-Beet Salad
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: Here's a delightfully different salad that balances the earthy flavor of beets with the natural sweetness of berries. If you prefer, substitute crumbled feta for the goat cheese.

ingredients.item: 1 each fresh red and golden beets

instructions.text: Place beets in an 8-in. square baking dish; add 1 in. of water. Cover and bake at 400° for 30-40 minutes or until tender.
Meanwhile, in a small bowl, whisk the vinegar, oil, honey, salt and pepper; set aside. Cool beets; peel and cut into thin slices.

In a large bowl, combine the beets, berries, walnuts and shallot. Pour dressing over beet mixture and toss gently to coat. Divide salad greens among 4 serving plates. Top with beet mixture; sprinkle with cheese and basil.

recipes.title: Classic Cobb Salad
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: Making this salad is a lot like putting in a garden. I plant everything in nice, neat sections, just as I do with seedlings.

ingredients.item: 1 medium ripe avocado, peeled and chopped
Optional: Sliced ripe olives and lemon wedges

instructions.text: Place lettuce on a platter or in a large serving bowl. Arrange remaining ingredients in rows or sections as desired. Serve with dressing of choice; if desired, serve with sliced ripe olives and lemon wedges.

recipes.title: Corn ‘n’ Cucumbers Salad
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: This cucumber corn salad was one of my mother's recipes and I think of her whenever I make it. It's a nice change from a regular cucumber salad.

ingredients.item: 2 medium cucumbers, peeled and thinly sliced

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Cover and chill for several hours.

recipes.title: Garden Bounty Panzanella Salad
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: My sister gave me fresh tomatoes and basil, so I made a bread salad known as Panzanella. The longer it sits, the more the bread soaks up the seasonings.

ingredients.item: 12 ounces French or ciabatta bread, cut into 1-inch cubes (about 1/2 cups)
1 medium green pepper, cut into 1-inch pieces
1 medium sweet yellow pepper, cut into 1-inch pieces
1 small red onion, halved and thinly sliced

instructions.text: In a large skillet, heat 2 tablespoons oil over medium heat. Add half of the bread cubes; cook and stir until toasted, about 8 minutes. Remove from pan. Repeat with remaining oil and bread cubes.
Combine bread cubes, tomatoes, cucumber, peppers, onion, basil, cheese, salt and pepper. Toss with dressing.

recipes.title: Honey-Mustard Brussels Sprouts Salad
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: Even if you dislike Brussels sprouts, you will love this dish. The dressing is so tasty, and it pairs amazingly with the apples, grapes and walnuts. You can also add whatever cheese, nuts or fruit you prefer.

ingredients.item: 1 pound fresh Brussels sprouts, trimmed and shredded

instructions.text: In a large bowl, combine the first 8 ingredients. In a small bowl, whisk remaining ingredients; pour over salad. Toss to coat.

recipes.title: Kiwi-Strawberry Spinach Salad
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: This pretty strawberry kiwi salad is always a hit when I serve it! The recipe came from a cookbook, but I personalized it. Sometimes just a small change in ingredients can create a big difference.

instructions.text: Place the first 5 ingredients in a blender; cover and process 30 seconds or until blended. Transfer to a small bowl; stir in green onions, sesame seeds and poppy seeds.
In a large bowl, combine spinach, strawberries and kiwi. Drizzle with dressing; toss to coat.

recipes.title: Quick Corn Salad
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: This sensational yet easy corn salad is a delight to serve because you can make it ahead, and it's an easy way to put garden bounty to good use. With colorful ingredients like corn, tomato and green pepper, it's also pretty in the bowl and on your plate.

ingredients.item: 2 cups fresh or frozen sweet corn

instructions.text: In a large bowl, combine vegetables; stir in dressing. Cover and refrigerate until serving.

recipes.title: Radish Cucumber Salad
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: I put this cucumber radish salad together with vegetables I had left in my garden. My family liked it so much, I started taking it to community suppers and was often asked for the recipe. It's a refreshing accompaniment for any entree.

instructions.text: In a serving bowl, combine the cucumber, radishes and onion. In a second bowl, combine the remaining ingredients. Pour over vegetables and toss to coat. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Roasted Apple Salad with Spicy Maple-Cider Vinaigrette
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: We bought loads of apples and needed to use them. To help the flavors come alive, I roasted the apples and tossed them with a sweet dressing.

ingredients.item: 4 medium Fuji, Gala or other firm apples, quartered
1 package (5 ounces) spring mix salad greens
1 log (4 ounces) fresh goat cheese, crumbled

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°. Place apples in a foil-lined 15x10x1-in. baking pan; drizzle with oil and toss to coat. Roast until tender, 20-30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Cool completely.
In a small bowl, whisk dressing ingredients until blended. In a large bowl, combine salad greens and dates. Drizzle dressing over salad and toss to coat.
Divide mixture among 8 plates. Top with goat cheese and roasted apples; sprinkle with pecans. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Shrimp Avocado Salad
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: Shrimp avocado salad mixes tender shellfish with fresh vegetables for a cool, protein-filled lunch or easy light dinner.

ingredients.item: 1 pound peeled and deveined cooked shrimp, coarsely chopped
3 medium ripe avocados, peeled and cubed

instructions.text: In a large bowl, combine the shrimp, tomatoes, green and red onions, jalapeno and serrano peppers, and cilantro. In a separate small bowl, mix the lime juice, vinegar, oil and adobo seasoning. Stir the dressing into the shrimp mixture.
Cover the bowl. Place it in the refrigerator until the flavors blend, about one hour.

Gently stir in the avocados. Serve the salad over lettuce or in lettuce leaves, alongside lime wedges. Editor's Tip: To make lettuce cups, cut out the white central core from a head of Bibb lettuce. Hold the head in your palm under cold running water, and carefully peel off the crunchy outer leaves, teasing each loose to stay whole. Pat the leaves dry with a clean tea towel before cradling the shrimp filling.

recipes.title: Spinach Salad with Warm Bacon Dressing
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: This spinach salad with warm bacon dressing proves that it's not difficult to get through an entire bag of spinach if it's dressed in a tangy, mustardy, brown-sugar bacon vinaigrette. Customize this classic salad with any toppings you like.

instructions.text: In a skillet, cook bacon over medium heat until crisp, stirring occasionally. Using a slotted spoon, remove bacon to paper towels. Discard all but 1 tablespoon drippings.
Add vinegar, garlic, brown sugar, mustard and seasonings to drippings; heat through, stirring to blend. Transfer to a small bowl; gradually whisk in oil. Stir in half of the bacon.
Place spinach, onion and eggs in a large bowl; toss with warm dressing. Sprinkle with remaining bacon; serve immediately.

recipes.title: Strawberry-Blue Cheese Steak Salad
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: At lunch one day, a friend told me about a steak salad she'd had at a party. It sounded so fantastic I had to try it for myself. My family would eat it nonstop if we could. Can't seem to get enough of that tangy dressing!

ingredients.item: 1 beef top sirloin steak (3/4 inch thick and 1 pound)

instructions.text: Season steak with salt and pepper. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add steak; cook 5-7 minutes on each side until meat reaches desired doneness (for medium-rare, a thermometer should read 135°; medium, 140°; medium-well, 145°). Remove from pan; let stand 5 minutes. Cut steak into bite-sized strips; toss with lime juice.
On a platter, combine romaine, strawberries and onion; top with steak. Sprinkle with cheese and walnuts. Serve with vinaigrette.

recipes.title: Tangerine Tossed Salad
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: My mother taught me how to cook when I was a young girl. The sweet tangerines and crunchy caramelized almonds make this one of my favorite recipes.

instructions.text: In a small skillet, cook and stir the almonds and 2 tablespoons sugar over medium-low heat for 25-30 minutes or until the sugar is melted and the almonds are toasted. Remove from the heat. Peel and section the tangerines, reserving 1 tablespoon juice.

In a large bowl, combine the lettuce, green onions, tangerines and almonds. In a small bowl, whisk the vinegar, oil, salt, pepper, reserved 1 tablespoon tangerine juice and remaining 1 tablespoon sugar. Pour over salad; toss to coat.

recipes.title: Tangy Cilantro Lime Confetti Salad
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: I love standout salads that burst with flavor

ingredients.item: 2 medium ripe avocados, peeled and cubed
1 cup fresh or frozen corn, thawed

instructions.text: Place the first 5 ingredients in a large bowl. Place dressing ingredients in a blender; cover and process until creamy and light in color. Pour over vegetable mixture; toss to coat. Refrigerate, covered, up to 3 hours.

recipes.title: Tomato Cucumber Mozzarella Salad
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: The fresher the ingredients, the tastier this tomato cucumber mozzarella salad will be. What's more, you can mix and match parts of this recipe to fit your preferences and use up what's already in your kitchen.

ingredients.item: 1 English cucumber, quartered and cut into 1/4-inch slices

instructions.text: In a large bowl, combine the tomatoes, cucumber, green pepper, onions, olives, parsley and basil. In a small bowl, whisk together the oil, vinegars, sugar, salt, oregano and pepper. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat.
Cover the salad and refrigerate it for at least 15 minutes. Just before serving, toss in the cheese. Serve the salad with a slotted spoon.

recipes.title: Tomato-Melon Chicken Salad
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: Nothing says summer like picking watermelon, tomatoes and raspberries, then tossing them together in a salad. The addition of grilled chicken makes it a satisfying summery meal.

ingredients.item: 4 grilled chicken breasts (4 ounces each), sliced

instructions.text: In a large bowl, combine the tomatoes, watermelon and raspberries. In a small bowl, whisk the basil, oil, vinegar, salt and pepper. Drizzle over tomato mixture; toss to coat. Divide salad greens among 6 serving plates; top with tomato mixture and chicken.

recipes.title: Twisted Eggs Benedict Salad
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: Salad for breakfast? Absolutely. You can prep everything except the dressing and chill it overnight. In the morning, dress the salad and poach the eggs.

ingredients.item: 1-1/2 pounds fresh asparagus, trimmed and chopped
8 ounces diced deli ham or Canadian bacon
6 cups baby kale salad blend (about 4 ounces)
1 cup chopped roasted sweet red peppers

instructions.text: In a large nonstick skillet, heat 1 tablespoon olive oil over medium heat. Add asparagus, fennel and ham; saute until vegetables are crisp-tender, about 8 minutes. Cool 3 minutes.
Toss vegetable mixture with salad blend, peppers and green onions. Whisk together mustard, vinegar, salt, pepper and the remaining oil until smooth.

In a large saucepan, bring water to a boil; reduce heat to a gentle simmer. Break eggs, 1 at a time, into a small bowl; slip eggs into water. Poach, uncovered, until whites are completely set and yolks begin to thicken, 3-5 minutes.
Meanwhile, toss salad with dressing. Divide salad among 8 plates. Using a slotted spoon, remove eggs from water; place 1 on top of each salad.

recipes.title: Zucchini Panzanella Salad
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: I learned how to make panzanella from my friend's grandmother. Once I discovered how to make the perfect vinaigrette, it became a dish I crave during the summer. It's also a great way to use day-old bread and your garden's bounty of zucchini.

ingredients.item: 1-1/2 cups heirloom mini or cherry tomatoes, halved

instructions.text: Place zucchini in a 15x10x1-in. baking pan. Toss with 1 tablespoon olive oil. Bake, uncovered, at 400° until tender and lightly browned, 25-30 minutes, stirring halfway through. Remove from the oven and cool.
Meanwhile, in a large bowl, toss bread cubes with 1 tablespoon olive oil. Transfer to a baking sheet. Bake at 400° until lightly browned, 12-14 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Place the cooled zucchini, toasted bread, tomatoes, green pepper and red onion in a large bowl. In a small bowl, whisk together vinegar, garlic, seasonings and remaining 2 tablespoons oil. Drizzle over salad; toss gently to combine. Add the mozzarella and stir to combine. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Barley Corn Salad
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: A terrific alternative to pasta salad, this colorful side dish adds refreshing herb flavor to corn, barley, and red and green peppers. Bring it to your next get-together and see how fast it disappears!

instructions.text: In a large bowl, combine the first 6 ingredients. In a jar with a tight-fitting lid, combine the lemon juice, oil, salt, thyme and pepper; shake well. Drizzle over salad and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

recipes.title: Steak Salad
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: This classic steak salad recipe features a perfectly cooked, well-seasoned steak atop a hearty mix of greens and toppings. It's a nutritious and quick dinner perfect for any night of the week.

ingredients.item: 1 teaspoon minced fresh thyme or 1/4 teaspoon dried thyme
1 beef flat iron steak or top sirloin steak (3/4 pound)
1/2 medium ripe avocado, peeled and thinly sliced
Optional: Crumbled blue cheese and additional pepper

instructions.text: For the dressing, whisk together the balsamic vinegar, olive oil, lemon juice, thyme, salt and pepper. Place the steak and 1/4 cup dressing in a shallow dish and turn to coat the steak with the marinade. Refrigerate for eight hours or overnight. Reserve the remaining dressing: Simply cover and refrigerate it until serving time.

When ready to cook the steak, drain the beef and discard the marinade. Grill the steak, covered, over medium heat. You can also broil it in a pan set 4 inches from the heat source. Cook the meat until it reaches desired doneness (for medium-rare steak, a thermometer should read 135°F; for medium, 140°). That will take about six to eight minutes per side, depending on how thick it is. Let the steak stand for 5 minutes before slicing.

To serve, divide salad greens among four plates. Top with the sliced steak, tomatoes, radishes and avocado; sprinkle with cranberries and, if desired, cheese and pepper. Serve with the reserved dressing. Editor's Tip: You can also dress the greens before plating the salad. Simply toss the greens in a large bowl with your desired amount of dressing until evenly coated. Plate the greens with the tomatoes, radishes and avocado, then sprinkle with cranberries and top with sliced steak.

recipes.title: Chili-Rubbed Steak with Black Bean Salad
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: Busy weeknights don't stop my husband from firing up the grill. This meal-in-one comes together fast. Try it with chimichurri and cotija cheese.

ingredients.item: 1 can (15 ounces) black beans, rinsed and drained

instructions.text: Rub steak with chili powder and salt. Grill, covered, over medium heat or broil 4 in. from heat 6-8 minutes on each side or until meat reaches desired doneness (for medium-rare, a thermometer should read 135°; medium, 140°).
Heat rice according to package directions. Transfer rice to a small bowl; stir in beans and salsa. Slice steak thinly across the grain; serve with bean salad. If desired, sprinkle with cilantro.

recipes.title: Chicken Salad with Grapes
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: Bored with the usual turkey sandwich? This easy chicken salad with grapes recipe is anything but boring! Shredded rotisserie chicken is dressed in a creamy dressing and tossed with juicy grapes, crunchy celery and chopped pecans.

ingredients.item: Lettuce leaves or whole wheat bread slices, optional

instructions.text: In a large bowl, combine the mayonnaise, sour cream, lemon juice, salt and pepper.
Add the chicken, grapes, pecans, celery and, if desired, onion. Mix lightly to coat. If desired, serve with lettuce leaves or whole wheat bread.

recipes.title: Greek Orzo Salad
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: This tart, refreshing salad is a big hit in my home. All the tasty toppings

ingredients.item: 1 medium cucumber, peeled, seeded and chopped
12 pitted ripe or Greek olives, halved

instructions.text: Cook the orzo according to package directions. Drain the orzo, and transfer to a large bowl. Toss with 2 teaspoons oil. Editor's Tip: Make sure to use a big pinch of salt in your pasta water! This will help infuse the orzo with some flavor from the start.

In a separate smaller bowl, whisk together the onion, parsley, vinegar, oregano, salt, sugar, pepper and remaining 4 teaspoons oil. Pour the onion mixture over the orzo, and toss to evenly coat. Cover and refrigerate until chilled. Just before serving, gently stir in the tomatoes, cucumber, olives and cheese.

recipes.title: Spaghetti Salad
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: We love how easy this spaghetti salad recipe is to prepare in advance. After it sets up in the fridge, it's a hearty, flavorful side dish or entree that's perfect for a crowd.

ingredients.item: 1 large cucumber, halved, seeded and diced

instructions.text: Cook the spaghetti according to the package directions, then drain and rinse it in cold water. Place the spaghetti in a large bowl, then add the tomatoes, zucchini, cucumber and peppers.
Combine the Italian dressing, Parmesan cheese, sesame seeds, poppy seeds, paprika, celery seed and garlic powder; pour over the salad and toss to coat.
Cover the salad and refrigerate it for at least two hours. Before serving, sprinkle it with chopped parsley, if desired.

recipes.title: Tuna Nicoise Salad
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: Tuna Nicoise salad is a perfect lunch for a weekend or even to make ahead for the work week. Our recipe is traditional with tuna, tomatoes and beans, but is easily adaptable to suit your tastes.

ingredients.item: 1/2 cup oil and vinegar salad dressing
3 pouches (2-1/2 ounces each) light tuna in water

instructions.text: Place the potatoes in a large saucepan and add water to cover. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and cook, uncovered, until tender, 8 to 10 minutes, adding the green beans during the last three minutes of cooking. Drain the pot and immediately drop the potatoes and beans into ice water. Drain and pat dry. Editor's Tip: You can salt the cooking water for extra flavor, but don't add the salt until the water is boiling. Salted water takes longer to bring to a boil.
In a small bowl, combine the salad dressing, lemon zest and pepper.

Divide the romaine among four plates. Arrange the potatoes, green beans, eggs, tuna and tomatoes over the romaine. Serve with the dressing mixture on the side or poured over, if you'll be eating immediately. Editor's Tip: Assembling the salad ingredients on separate plates allows for an attractive presentation and ensures an even distribution of the larger ingredients. Unlike many other types of salad, Nicoise is rarely tossed together.

recipes.title: Couscous Salad
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: This couscous salad recipe gets five stars from our reviewers! Create a versatile, summery salad that can be served as a potluck dish or a light lunch. Or, feel free to add chickpeas, grilled meat or seafood to make it filling enough to enjoy for dinner.

ingredients.item: 3 medium ears sweet corn, husks removed
1 cup reduced-sodium chicken broth or vegetable broth

instructions.text: Place the corn in a Dutch oven, and cover the corn with water. Bring the water to a boil. Cover and cook for six to nine minutes or until the corn is tender. Editor's Tip: If you're using frozen corn, you can go ahead and skip this step. Thaw it in the refrigerator overnight, and either add it to the salad as-is or heat it in a skillet to give it some depth.

While the corn is cooking, in a small saucepan, bring the broth to a boil. Stir in the couscous, then remove the pan from the heat. Cover and let stand for 5 to 10 minutes or until the broth is absorbed. Fluff the couscous with a fork and set it aside to cool slightly.
In a large bowl, combine the cucumber, tomatoes, cheese, onion and parsley.

Drain the corn and immediately place it in ice water. Drain off the water and pat the corn dry. Cut the kernels from the cobs. Editor's Tip: Check out the video below for our Test Kitchen's mess-free corn-cutting method. We balance the ear on the center of a fluted tube pan, allowing the tall-sided bowl to catch the kernels as they're cut.
Add the corn to the cucumber mixture. Stir in the couscous.
In a small bowl, whisk the oil, lemon juice, oregano, cumin, salt and pepper. Pour the dressing over the couscous mixture and toss to coat. Serve immediately, or cover and refrigerate until chilled.

recipes.title: Chopped Chicken Caesar Salad Sandwiches
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - World Cuisines
recipes.description: Imagine: A creamy garlicky dressing, crunchy romaine lettuce and hearty chicken all encased in a chewy bun that's like a super-sized crouton. These chopped chicken Caesar salad sandwiches are simple, delightful and perfect for salad lovers.

ingredients.item: 1 can (12-1/2 ounces) chunk white chicken, drained or 1 cup finely chopped cooked chicken

instructions.text: In a large bowl, add the chopped cooked chicken, romaine lettuce, tomatoes, dressing and cheese. Stir until well combined.
Divide the mixture among the bottom halves of the rolls. Sprinkle with freshly cracked pepper, if desired.

Press on the top bun and secure with toothpicks, if desired. Serve immediately. Editor's Tip: This recipe would make a delicious open-faced sandwich. The top bun helps hold the lettuce mixture in, but the top bun isn't totally necessary if you're a pro at eating toast with toppings.

recipes.title: Crunchy Cucumber and Fennel Salad
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - World Cuisines
recipes.description: I created this when my herbs were overflowing. It makes for a refreshing, crunchy salad to enjoy on those hot summer days. I used an English cucumber because of its mild flavor, but other types can be used as well.

instructions.text: In a large bowl, whisk together the first six ingredients until smooth. Whisk in parsley, chives and dill; set aside.
Place cucumbers in a colander over a plate; sprinkle with salt and toss. Let stand 20 minutes. Rinse and blot dry with paper towels.
Add cucumber, fennel and celery to dressing; toss to coat. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Refrigerate until chilled, about 1 hour, before serving.

recipes.title: Fattoush Salad
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - World Cuisines
recipes.description: This type of bread salad is very popular in the Middle East. It uses sumac, which is a distinctive spice that adds an acidic flavor to dishes, as does lemon juice.

ingredients.item: 1 medium green pepper, cut into 1-inch pieces

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°. Arrange pita breads in a single layer on an ungreased baking sheet; brush with oil and sprinkle with salt. Bake until crisp, 8-10 minutes, turning once. Cool. Meanwhile, in a large bowl, toss lettuce, cucumbers, tomatoes, green pepper, parsley, mint and radishes. Break toasted pitas into small pieces over salad. In a small bowl, whisk olive oil, lemon juice, salt, sumac and pepper. Drizzle over salad; toss to coat.

recipes.title: Mediterranean Chickpea Salad
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - World Cuisines
recipes.description: For a high-protein cold meal that comes together quickly, you can't go wrong with Mediterranean chickpea salad. It's loaded with fresh flavors and works as a side dish with a Med-style dinner, or on its own as a light lunch.

ingredients.item: 2 cans (15 ounces each) garbanzo beans or chickpeas, rinsed and drained

instructions.text: In a large serving bowl, combine the beans, onion, olives, peppers, celery and Parmesan cheese. Measure the olive oil, balsamic vinegar, parsley, sugar, onion powder, basil and oregano into a Mason jar or other jar with a tight-fitting lid, and shake them together vigorously to emulsify the vinaigrette. Pour the dressing over the chickpea mixture, and toss the salad until the beans and vegetables are well coated.

recipes.title: Gremolata Pasta Salad
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - World Cuisines
recipes.description: Straying from heavier, mayonnaise-based pasta salads, I created this lighter olive oil-based salad. Lemon juice, feta cheese, garlic and tomatoes brighten up this colorful dish.

ingredients.item: 1 pound fresh asparagus, trimmed and cut into 1/2-inch pieces

instructions.text: Cook pasta according to package directions, adding asparagus during the last 3 minutes of cooking; drain and rinse with cold water.

In a large serving bowl, combine parsley, lemon juice, lemon zest and garlic. Add pasta mixture, tomatoes and olive oil; toss thoroughly to combine. Gently stir in feta. Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate until serving.

recipes.title: Japanese Crab and Avocado Salad
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - World Cuisines
recipes.description: It can be a challenge to find winter holiday recipes that are suited to warmer climates. This luxurious Asian-inspired crab salad fills the bill with its festive colors and flavors.

ingredients.item: 1 red chili pepper, seeded and finely chopped
2 medium ripe avocados, peeled and cubed

instructions.text: In a large bowl, whisk together mirin, rice vinegar, salt, wasabi and sesame oil.
In a small bowl combine crab and chili pepper. Toss with 1 tablespoon wasabi dressing; set aside.
Add salad mix, avocado, and lime juice to the bowl with the remaining dressing. Divide amongst 6 salad plates. Top each with crab salad, garnish with chives.

recipes.title: 7-Layer Salad
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - World Cuisines
recipes.description: This colorful 7-layer salad is as beautiful as it is delicious. Build it in a clear glass bowl to show off the layers at potlucks, picnics and holiday celebrations.

ingredients.item: 1 tablespoon snipped fresh dill or 1 teaspoon dill weed

instructions.text: In a large salad bowl, layer all the salad ingredients in the following order: Start with the lettuce, followed by the parsley, sliced hard-boiled eggs and chopped tomatoes. Continue with the peas, bacon, cheese and onion. Editor's Tip: A clear glass trifle dish or deep glass mixing bowl is a must for showing off the colorful layers!
In a small bowl, stir the mayonnaise, sour cream, dill, basil, salt and pepper until they're smooth and creamy.

Carefully spread the dressing over the top of the salad. Editor's Tip: Spread the dressing all the way to the edges. This will create a seal that helps keep the veggies fresh and crisp until serving time.
Cover the bowl with storage wrap or a lid and place it in the refrigerator for several hours or overnight. Just before serving, sprinkle with extra dill, if desired.

recipes.title: Chicken Salad With Greek Yogurt
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - World Cuisines
recipes.description: This 15-minute Chicken Salad Chick copycat recipe has become one of my very favorite meals. But it needn’t even be a meal! The chicken salad is so scrumptious on crackers or as the dip on a crudite platter.

instructions.text: Combine all of the ingredients except for the parsley. Mix well. Sprinkle with fresh parsley just before serving.

recipes.title: Tomato Tuna Tower Salad
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - World Cuisines
recipes.description: In this quick and easy tomato tuna tower salad recipe, thick slices of juicy, ripe tomatoes serve as the perfect platform for mounds of flavor-packed tuna salad.

ingredients.item: 1 can (5 ounces) albacore white tuna in water, drained
1 can (15 ounces) navy beans, rinsed and drained
2 large tomatoes, cut into 2 thick slices

instructions.text: In a food processor or high-powered blender, combine the extra virgin olive oil, lemon juice, shallots, fresh parsley, Dijon mustard, lemon zest and sea salt. Process until smooth.
In a large bowl, stir together the tuna, navy beans and celery. Add the vinaigrette and toss to coat.
Place the tomato slices onto four plates. Divide the tuna mixture over the top of each one and sprinkle with pine nuts. Garnish with fresh cracked black pepper before serving.

instructions.text: Hard-boil the eggs, throw them into cold water, remove the shells, cut them lengthwise. Take out the yolks without breaking the whites. Rub the yolks through a sieve into a bowl, then add the to ngue and all the seasoning. If the mixture is dry add a tablespoonful or two of cream or olive oil. Roll the mixture into balls that will fit the spaces from which they were taken in the whites, making each ball round. arrange the lettuce over a platter, stand the whites in the lettuce, and at serving time baste thoroughly with French dressing.

MOLDED SALADS: Before using the mold or molds when making gelatin salads, rinse them in cold water. Leave excess moisture on the molds, or brush molds lightly with salad oil. If square sided molds are used they can be lined with strips of cellophane. recipes.title: Green Chile Salad
recipes.source_note: The Chile Bible (IMG_6032)
recipes.description: A fresh salad with tomatoes, onion, and green chiles in a vinegar dressing.

instructions.text: Combine the vinegar and salad oil. Rub a bowl with the cut clove of garlic and add the sliced tomato, onion, and green chiles.
Add the vinegar and salad oil and toss gently.
Serve on lettuce leaves or in the center of scoops of small curd cottage cheese.

recipes.title: Marinated Garden Salad
recipes.source_note: The Chile Bible (IMG_6032)
recipes.description: Fresh vegetables marinated with green chiles and lemon in a tangy dressing.

ingredients.item: green chiles, roasted, peeled and sliced
Tbsp green onions or chives, minced

instructions.text: Toss together the tomatoes, green chiles, onions, and lemon slices.
Add oil, vinegar, salt, pepper, and oregano. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator at least 2 hours.
At serving time, remove the lemon slices and serve the salad in lettuce cups.

recipes.title: Piquant Salad
recipes.source_note: The Chile Bible (IMG_6034)
recipes.description: A gelatin salad with tomato and green chile sauce.

instructions.text: Dissolve the gelatin in 1 cup hot water in an 8x8x2-inch pan.
Stir until lightly thickened and add the remaining ingredients. Chill until set.

missing_inputs: 1 can (8 oz) tomato and green chile sauce

recipes.title: Green Chile and Cucumber Salad
recipes.source_note: The Chile Bible (IMG_6034)
recipes.description: A molded gelatin salad with cucumber and green chiles.

instructions.text: Dissolve the gelatin according to the package directions. Stir in the remaining ingredients.
Place in 12 large paper baking cups in muffin tins and spoon the gelatin mixture into them. Chill until firm.
